p: It is well documented that there is direct relationship between phenolic and flavonoid contents and antioxidant activity of herbal extracts [ 36, 37]. In one study, the antioxidant (free radical scavenging) activity in D. viscosa has been shown to be directly dependent on content of phenol flavonoid. The methanol extract of D. viscosa showed 50.72% free radical scavenging activity at 50 μg/mL of phenol and it increased to 92.45% at 1000 μg/mL [ 12]. Similarly, another study reported 82% of radical scavenging inhibition activity with 300 μl while 80% with 100 µl of flower extract of D. viscosa [ 38].
